title: Bay Area Things To Do
name: Bay Area Things To Do
description:
A Map by Finkster

Where to visit on any trip to the city.

To overlay all my favorite restaurants, bars and cafes on this map, make sure see &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.platial.com/finkster/places&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot;&gt;all Finkster's Places&lt;/a&gt; so you can find local joints nearby to nosh and drink at.

properties.name: Alcatraz
properties.description: Posted by FinksterTourists welcome....you have to visit The Rock at least once in your lifetime. See website above for ferry info.

properties.name: Angel Island
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Angel Island was the Ellis Island of the west, but also played its part in one of our nation\'s uglier moments while implementing the Chinese Exclusion Act of 1882, becoming the location where racial profiling was used as part of interrogation techniques at the immigration station. During WWII, it was also used as a US Army POW processing center. ngel Island is one of the most picturesque places in the bay, giving panoramic views of the city skyline and the bridges. A wonderful all day excursion with a stop over in Tiburon for drinks or lunch. You can bring your bikes on the ferry if you like. It\'s a about a 2 hour walk around the island. Ferry info is in the web link above.

properties.name: Baker Beach
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  Another great beach with classic views of the Golden Gate...this is where the old B&W picture of the bridge under construction was taken from. Worth a view and a drive through the Presidio which is now a National Park.

properties.name: Buena Vista Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 2765 Hyde St, San Francisco, CAHistoric cafe with great views of the bay...where the Irish Coffee was invented. While touristy, right off of Ghirardelli square, you have to try at least one Irish Coffee.

properties.name: Cable Car Terminus
properties.description: Posted by FinksterCatch the cable car at Powell & Market St, or better yet, jump on mid-way...don\'t forget to stand on the running boards and hang off the side! Make sure to buy a ticket first. There are several cable car lines, but this line goes all the way to Ghiradelli Square near Marina Green. It\'s a fun and inexpensive way to get across the City.

properties.name: California Academy of Science and Steinhart Aquarium
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 875 Howard St, San Francisco, CA, 94103The academy includes the excellent Steinhart aquarium, reptilian exhibits, excellent kids discovery experiences and a natural history exhibit. Note that the academy is temporarily located at this facility while the Golden Gate Park facility is being renovated.

properties.name: Coit Tower
properties.description: Posted by Finkster1 Telegraph Hill Blvd, San Francisco, CABest view of the City and bay from a hill top. Costs $ to climb the historic fire hose design building, but it is a fantastic view.

properties.name: Conservatory of Flowers
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  Golden Gate ParkLocated at 100 John F Kennedy Dr. The recently renovated conservatory contains a stunning collection of tropical plants and orchids in a beautiful example of a traditional Victorian conservatory construction. Make sure to stop in while visiting the de Young or the Japanese Tea Garden.

properties.name: Dolores Park
properties.description: Posted by FinksterDolores St and 19th St, San Francisco, CAIn the height of the Mission, one of the storied views from San Francisco that you\'ll remember from many movies.

properties.name: Exploratorium
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 3601 Lyon Street, San Francisco, CAWonderfully creative science museum for kids and adults. An absolute must if you bring kids to the city.

properties.name: Ferry Building Marketplace
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  Best culinary experience in the city. Beautiful restored ferry building, now exclusively high end foods and shopping. Saturday morning Farmer\'s Market is a must for local foods. Favorites include: * Cowgirl Creamery - best cheese on the West Coast * Wine Bar * Far West Funghi - buy the Truffle Salt and put it on popcorn * The Slanted Door - Fusion Vietnamese restaurant, one of the best places in the city. Great Belgian beer and Riesling selection. * Ciao Bella - Gelato * Della Fattoria - Italian wood oven baked breads * ....and so much more!

properties.name: Ghirardelli Chocolates @ Ghirardelli Square
properties.description: Posted by Finkster900 N Point St, San Francisco, CAThe original Ghirardelli location...where to get your fab chocolate souvenirs before you go home. But really, they have a great ice cream sundae store run by Ghirardelli that is great on a warm vacation day.

properties.name: Harigara Japanese Tea Garden
properties.description: Posted by Finkster   Thought the fortune cookie was chinese? In fact it\'s an American invention, created at the Japanese Tea Garden as a special snack for the World Exposition in celebration of the rebuilding of the city after the 1906 earthquake devastation. The Tea Garden is a beautifully maintained and peaceful place in the middle of Golden Gate Park. Take a calming stroll, and share some tea in the tea house.

properties.name: Kids Discovery Museum
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  557 McReynolds Rd, Sausalito, CAHands on science and discovery museum at the foot of the Golden Gate bridge. Great location, and great for kids.

properties.name: Legion of Honor
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  100 34th Ave, San Francisco, CAThe Palace of the Legion of Honor and museum sits atop a hill at the end of the City, providing fantastic views of the Golden Gate Bridge. The museum houses special exhibitions and a lovely permanent collection in cluding European art, art on paper, and 18th century English and French porcelain.

properties.name: Lombard St (Curviest Street)
properties.description: Posted by FinksterYes, you have to do Lombard St at least once to see the curviest street in the world.

properties.name: Marin Headlands - Bridge View!
properties.description: Posted by FinksterOK, ever wonder where everyone takes those great bridge pictures, well you now have found it! A steep incline on the north side of the GG Bridge, the headlands provide an amazing view above the bridge...enjoy! I never get tired of this view.

properties.name: Marin Headlands - Fort Cronkite
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Beautiful day hike and picnic location on the ocean side. So close to San Francisco via the Golden Gate you\'d hardly believe you just left the City. Beautiful views towards the bridge and the ocean, classic Northern California rugged coastline.

properties.name: Metreon
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  101 4th St # 500, San Francisco, CAThe Sony Metreon houses the largest theaters in the City, IMAX, Sony Store, game salon, and Gillians restaurant and pool hall. Next door to the Metreon is the Zeum Discovery Museum, Carousel ride, ice skating and bowling alley. Generally a great center for entertaining kids.

properties.name: Monterey Bay Aquarium
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 866 Cannery Row, Monterey, CAThe Monterey Bay Aquarium is widely considered the finest aquarium in the world. The Outer Bay Aquarium featuring various sharks and tuna is simply stunning in its shear size and beauty...but only to be outdone by the jellyfish permanent exhibit which lets you get up closer than ever before to hundreds of beautiful jellys in the most serene environment. Great for kids and adults, this is a must visit if you are in the bay area for an extended period. Monterey is approximately 2.5 hours south of San Francisco.

properties.name: Pier 39 - Ferry to Tiburon, Alcatraz
properties.description: Posted by FinksterPier 39 is a vast wasteland for tourists...however it is a great place to catch the ferries to Tiburon and do an Alcatraz tour for those interested. See http://www.blueandgoldfleet.com for ferry details. The Tiburon ferry gives you an awesome bay tour, goes past Alcatraz, and gets you to the ferry dock that takes you to Angel Island for a beatiful day hike if you\'re into that. Also see "Sam\'s Anchor Cafe" and "Guaymas" for food and drink choices in Tiburon.

properties.name: SF MOMA
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  151 Third Street San Francisco, CA 94103The Museum of Modern Art houses fantastic collections of sculpture, painting, photography, architecture and design, and media arts. The MOMA building itself is a fascinating architectural design example and is well worth the visit.

properties.name: The Tech Museum of Innovation
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  201 South Market Street, San Jose, caWhile many other museums are about core sciences and discovery, The Tech, placed in the heart of Silicon Valley, embodies technology integration at its finest. The Tech houses hundreds of technology innovations of the computer era and beyond and makes a fascinating trip for visitors young and old.

properties.name: Westfield San Francisco Centre
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 855 Market St, San Francisco, CAThe San Francisco Centre near Union Square is the shopping Mecca of San Francisco with the newly opened Emporium building being added to the center. The center includes the latest new high end fashion boutiques and a brand new Bloomingdale\'s and Nordstrom. Don\'t forget to visit the food center downstairs to find unique culinary fair, and go to the top of the Emporium building to see the all glass rotunda.

properties.name: de Young Museum
properties.description: Posted by Finkster    50 Hagiwara Tea Garden Drive, San Francisco, CAThe new de Young museum has been completely re-built and is a must see building in city, particularly the view from the top of the cube. The museum houses an excellent permanent modern art collection. Check the website for current special exhibits.
